components/esm/loadnpcc.hpp

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #ifndef _ESM_NPCC_H
00002 #define _ESM_NPCC_H
00003 
00004 #include "esm_reader.hpp"
00005 
00006 namespace ESM {
00007 
00008 /*
00009  * NPC change information (found in savegame files only). We can't
00010  * read these yet.
00011  *
00012  * Some general observations about savegames:
00013  *
00014  * Magical items/potions/spells/etc are added normally as new ALCH,
00015  * SPEL, etc. records, with unique numeric identifiers.
00016  *
00017  * Books with ability enhancements are listed in the save if they have
00018  * been read.
00019  *
00020  * GLOB records set global variables.
00021  *
00022  * SCPT records do not define new scripts, but assign values to the
00023  * variables of existing ones.
00024  *
00025  * STLN - stolen items, ONAM is the owner
00026  *
00027  * GAME - contains a GMDT (game data) of unknown format
00028  *
00029  * VFXM, SPLM, KLST - no clue
00030  *
00031  * PCDT - seems to contain a lot of DNAMs, strings?
00032  *
00033  * FMAP - MAPH and MAPD, probably map data.
00034  *
00035  * JOUR - the entire journal in html
00036  *
00037  * QUES - seems to contain all the quests in the game, not just the
00038  * ones you have done or begun.
00039  *
00040  * REGN - lists all regions in the game, even unvisited ones.
00041  *
00042  * The DIAL/INFO blocks contain changes to characters' dialog status.
00043  *
00044  * Dammit there's a lot of stuff in there! Should really have
00045  * suspected as much. The strategy further is to completely ignore
00046  * save files for the time being.
00047  *
00048  * Several records have a "change" variant, like NPCC, CNTC
00049  * (contents), and CREC (creature.) These seem to alter specific
00050  * instances of creatures, npcs, etc. I have not identified most of
00051  * their subrecords yet.
00052  *
00053  * Several NPCC records have names that begin with "chargen ", I don't
00054  * know if it means something special yet.
00055  *
00056  * The CNTC blocks seem to be instances of leveled lists. When a
00057  * container is supposed to contain this leveled list of this type,
00058  * but is referenced elsewhere in the file by an INDX, the CNTC with
00059  * the corresponding leveled list identifier and INDX will determine
00060  * the container contents instead.
00061  *
00062  * Some classes of objects seem to be altered, and these include an
00063  * INDX, which is probably an index used by specific references other
00064  * places within the save file. I guess this means 'use this class for
00065  * these objects, not the general class.' All the indices I have
00066  * encountered so far are zero, but they have been for different
00067  * classes (different containers, really) so possibly we start from
00068  * zero for each class. This looks like a mess, but is probably still
00069  * easier than to duplicate everything. I think WRITING this format
00070  * will be harder than reading it.
00071  */
00072 
00073 struct LoadNPCC
00074 {
00075   void load(ESMReader &esm)
00076   {
00077     esm.skipRecord();
00078   }
00079 };
00080 }
00081 #endif
